newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Transport talks to tackle tolls technology.
newsitem.headline: Transport talks to tackle tolls technology.

text.p: The Dutch presidency will present transport ministers on Friday with its ideas on coordinating national electronic systems for road pricing and traffic data collection.

The Netherlands, with its huge road haulage sector, is worried about the prospect of having to fit several different systems in its lorry cabs in order to travel across EU internal borders in the future.

"The presidency has taken note of the fact that much solid work is being done in this area on various levels and in various panels but unfortunately there also seems to be a concurrent lack of coherence and clear setting of priorities," it said in a press briefing note.

"The development of various systems threatens to result in a rather unsatisfactory situation for international road traffic, since it is very likely that a separate device will have to be installed in the vehicle for each separate system," it said.

The Dutch want ministers to back efforts to agree standardisation for short-range communications links between vehicles and road-side equipment, to support the launching of more real-life pilot projects and to exchange ideas garnered from national experience.
